elements.title: Stikine River (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to Tlingit legend, the Stikine River (pictured) once flowed under a glacier?

elements.title: Gloria Dea (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Hollywood Golden Age actress Gloria Dea was the first magician to perform on the Las Vegas Strip, at the El Rancho Vegas hotel and casino on May 14, 1941?

elements.title: A Sun (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Taiwanese film about parental favoritism was titled A Sun in English to create a pun with "a son"?

elements.title: Handan Chun (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Handan Chun wrote a poem on the game of pitch-pot?

elements.title: Sung Min Song (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sung Min Song, who was an informatics engineer in Seoul until age 26, performed the extreme tenor role of Arnold in Rossini's Guillaume Tell as his debut at the Saarländisches Staatstheater?

elements.title: Edward V. Boursaud (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Edward V. Boursaud was the first American assistant secretary to the Jesuit Superior General for the English-speaking world?

elements.title: Seyrani Monument (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Gürdal Duyar's 1976 Seyrani Monument became a symbol of the Develi district?

elements.title: Chaos with Ed Miliband (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ed Miliband retweeted "Chaos with Ed Miliband" with a clown emoji during the October 2022 United Kingdom government crisis?
